title: Dunelm's 'chic' and 'affordable' textured sofa will transform your living space - and it unfolds into a double bed for holiday hosting - Netmums
text:
This article contains affiliate links, which means we may earn a small amount of money if a reader clicks through and makes a purchase.
When it comes to homeware essentials, Dunelm is our one-stop shop for everything from non-iron bedding to floor lamps with added storage. (We're even getting all of our Jellycat dupes from there now, too.)
And as we plan ahead for our seasonal hosting duties, Dunelm's multitasking furniture pieces are stylish and practical alternatives to blow-up mattresses and sleeping bags.
Like this chic velvet sofa bed that folds out into a single mattress for overnight guests.
And our new favourite furniture piece: this brightly coloured textured sofa bed that looks and feels modern, but also timeless... and opens up to sleep overnight guests in comfort and style.
© Dunelm
What is Dunelm's textured clic clac sofa bed?
Dunelm's textured sherpa sofa bed is perfect for adding a pop of colour and texture to any room.
The multi-functional clic clac sofa bed is covered in a thick, dark red sherpa fabric.
It has rounded arms, a button-back detail and is finished with metal legs, and its styling is contemporary but also feels retro-inspired. We think this would fit in perfectly with a minimalist or mid-century aesthetic. (This sofa bed could totally work as interiors on Mad Men.)
It measures 82cm x 180cm x 86cm, with a 42cm back and 22cm legs and comfortably sits two people. It pulls out into a double bed to comfortably sleep one (and less comfortably, a couple). There's also some underseat storage room to tuck away extra sheets.
The sofa bed is priced at £299, which is a 'very affordable option for a recliner sofa bed', according to one customer, who notes the piece is easy to assemble and the 'quality is good and sturdy'. (It's been tested to 220kg.)
If you're after a coordinated look, there's a matching armchair for £169 and a coordinating footstool for £39.
Elements Finn Textured Sherpa Clic Clac Sofa Bed, £299 at Dunelm
What other overnight essentials can I buy now?
Lidl is selling a foldable overnight mattress for just under £50, that stores away easily in cupboards and under beds.
And Aldi's currently got Emma pillows for £14.99 – these might be the perfect price point for guests, but you'll want to sleep on these yourself, too.
If you want to pay a bit more for a larger piece of furniture, IKEA's FRIHETEN / KLAGSHAMN sofa bed is a modern classic that starts from £674.
5 FAQs on Dunelm's Textured Sherpa Clic Clac Sofa Bed
1. What is Dunelm’s textured clic clac sofa bed?
It’s a multi-functional sofa bed designed by Dunelm, upholstered in dark red sherpa fabric with rounded arms, button-back detail and metal legs. It combines modern style with retro influences, ideal for minimalist or mid-century decor.
2. How much does it cost and what are its dimensions?
The sofa bed is priced at £299. It measures 82cm (H) × 180cm (W) × 86cm (D), with a 42cm back height and 22cm legs, seating two people comfortably.
3. How does the clic clac mechanism work?
The clic clac style sofa easily unfolds into a double bed that can comfortably sleep one person or a cosy couple. It also includes under-seat storage for sheets or bedding.
4. What do customers say about it?
Buyers praise it as an affordable and sturdy option, highlighting its easy assembly and good quality for the price. It can support up to 220kg.
5. Are there matching or alternative options available?
Dunelm offers a matching armchair (£169) and footstool (£39). For other overnight solutions, Lidl sells a foldable mattress for just under £50 and IKEA’s FRIHETEN/KLAGSHAMN sofa bed starts at £674 for a larger furniture piece.
